DataElement.preferredName: Ejection Fraction From Echocardiography Or Radionuclide Study Assessment Percentage Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: a measure of how much blood pumps out from the left ventricle of the heart with each contraction as a percentage of 100 indicated by a procedure that uses ultrasonic waves directed over the chest wall to obtain a graphic record of the heart's position or by an analysis of using a small dose of a radioactive chemical (isotope) called a tracer that can detect sites of cancer growth, trauma, infection or degenerative disorders.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Ejection Fraction From Echocardiography Or Radionuclide Study Assessment
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: a measure of how much blood pumps out from the left ventricle of the heart with each contraction indicated by a procedure that uses ultrasonic waves directed over the chest wall to obtain a graphic record of the heart's position or by an analysis of using a small dose of a radioactive chemical (isotope) called a tracer that can detect sites of cancer growth, trauma, infection or degenerative disorders.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The ejection fraction (or, more correctly, left-ventricular ejection fraction, often abbreviated LVEF) is a measure of how much blood the left ventricle of the heart pumps out with each contraction. With each beat, a normal heart ejects about one-half to two-thirds of the blood in its left chamber. (Wikipedia)

Concepts.longName: Measurement of Left Ventricular Ejection Fraction
Concepts.definition: A measure of how much blood the left ventricle of the heart pumps out with each contraction. With each beat, a normal heart ejects about one-half to two-thirds of the blood in its left chamber.

Property.preferredName: From Echocardiography Or Radionuclide Imaging Study Assessment
Property.preferredDefinition: Used to indicate a specified place or time as a starting point; used to indicate a source, cause, agent, or instrument.:A procedure that uses ultrasonic waves directed over the chest wall to obtain a graphic record of the heart's position, motion of the walls, or internal parts such as the valves.:An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.:An imaging technique that uses a small dose of a radioactive chemical (isotope) called a tracer that can detect sites of cancer growth, trauma, infection or degenerative disorders. The tracer, which is either injected into a vein or swallowed, travels through the bloodstream to the target organ, and emits gamma rays, which are detected by a gamma camera and analyzed by a computer to form an image of the target organ.:A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it; the activities undertaken during a study.:Having determined the value, significance, or extent of.

Concepts.definition: Used to indicate a specified place or time as a starting point; used to indicate a source, cause, agent, or instrument.
A procedure that uses high-frequency sound waves (ultrasound) to create an image of the heart.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.

An imaging technique that uses a small dose of a radioactive chemical (isotope) called a tracer that can detect sites of cancer growth, trauma, infection or degenerative disorders. The tracer, which is either injected into a vein or swallowed, travels through the bloodstream to the target organ, and emits gamma rays, which are detected by a gamma camera and analyzed by a computer to form an image of the target organ.
A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.
The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Changed from CTEP to COG for by script Thu Jan 2 10:00:57 EST 2014

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the value as a percentage of 100.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Percentage; a fraction or ratio with 100 understood as the denominator.:A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Concepts.definition: A fraction or ratio with 100 understood as the denominator.
A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.
